bibl.title: On the Identity of Shahrālānyōzān in the Greek and Middle Persian Papyri from Egypt.
Documents and the History of the Early Islamic World

bibl.note: Suggests grounds for identifying Shahralanyozan with Shahrvaraz, the powerful general who led Khusro's invasion of Mesopotamia in 608/9, of Syria in 610, and, most notoriously, of Palestine in 613.
bibl.seg: Jairus Banaji, On the Identity of Shahrālānyōzān in the Greek and Middle Persian Papyri from Egypt.
Alexander T. Schubert & Petra M. Sijpesteijn (edd.), Documents and the History of the Early Islamic World = Islamic History and Civilization. Studies and Texts. 111 (Leiden - Boston, 2014) pp. 27-42.
Suggests grounds for identifying Shahralanyozan with Shahrvaraz, the powerful general who led Khusro's invasion of Mesopotamia in 608/9, of Syria in 610, and, most notoriously, of Palestine in 613.
